data.title: cmake: fancy colors for modern compilers
data.body: a naive attempt at enabling colors in supporting compilers.

data.title: Integrate valgrind support for tests and demos
data.body:
As the game is getting bigger and bigger, running valgrind on the `./openage` full launch takes ages on my machine.

Some convenient support for launching tests and analyzing those with valgrind will help finding issues and reduce running times.

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Memory block allocator
data.body: This is mainly a splitup and fixup of @schets #150. Opinions?

data.title: Codestyle updates and simplifications
data.body: The codestyle info files needed some updates, please complain about obscurities.

data.title: codecompliance: fixed error messages for legal header copyright years
data.body:
The compliance checker printed only the first digit of the expected year when one of the copyright years in the legal header was wrong. This should now work correctly.

Also the "from git history" part still assumed that the topmost git log entry is the most recent one (this is no longer true when someone swaps commits during a rebase, see Jonas' previous commit on that file).
I deleted that part since I didn't come up with an easy fix immediately (and I don't think it is useful, just use git log if there are problems).

data.title: Switch minimum compiler version to GCC 4.9/Clang 3.5
data.body:
There has been discussion on the IRC channel about ditching GCC 4.8/Clang 3.4 support in order to make use of some new language features.

The obvious downside is that parts of the user/developer base would need to upgrade their toolchains, which may or may not require unreasonable effort.

I have been assured that Clang 3.5 is available on OSX Mountain Lion and upwards through XCode 6. The recent compiler versions are available on Debian testing-soon-to-be-stable as well as the most recent (non-LTS) version of Ubuntu.

What about mingw cross-compilers and other Linux distributions?

This issue is intended as a platform for discussion.

data.title: New features for job manager and integration into dynamic audio loading.
data.body:
I have added some features to the job manager.
1. job groups that assure, that multiple jobs are executed on the same background thread
2. jobs can check whether they should be aborted and abort themselves

Further I have integrated the new job groups into the dynamic audio loading implementation.

data.title: This is a simple to use and efficient rng.
data.body:
It provides an easy and reliable way of reproducible random numbers,
along with platform-independent serialization. There is also a thread-safe global rng, although it makes no promises about the order in which requests will be processed.

data.title: convert script updates and memory fixes
data.body:
Includes the #186 changes for loading the "missing" texure lazily.
Additionally, fixed pointer owners by smart pointers (`unique_ptr`, `shared_ptr`).

More convert script updates: Variables for tech, units, terrain, graphics and sounds uncovered.

Fixes to the codecompliance script to be compatible with `git rebase` and `cherry-pick`.

Also we got some new ideas from 31c3 people :grinning:

data.title: Create test cases for existing subsystems
data.body:
Because reasons we should add more tests to the code.

Substems with test coverage:
- [X] Pathfinding
- [x] Jobmanager
- [ ] Terrain blending
- [x] Coordinate system
- [ ] Asset manager
- [ ] Logger

For the missing ones, please create some creative tests.
An example how that could look like can be seen in `libopenage/datastructure/`.

data.title: Create data/asset integrity check
data.body:
To speed up loading, all files should only be accessed on demand.

This means file access errors will be encountered at game runtime only.

-> We have to create a gamedata integrity check which verifies the existence and consistency of all assets.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7502427-create-data-asset-integrity-check?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: convert: fixes strings with garbage data past their \0 terminators
data.body:
Real world case: empires2_x1.dat has a string `b'M\x00\xf8\x004"\xf8\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00'` for one of the graphic `name1`s, which has a bunch of garbage after its terminator. `data.decode('utf-8')` trips up on this because `\xf8` is not a valid unicode char.

This patches `zstr` to truncate data to right before the first \0, or to keep it entirely if there is no \0, before utf8-decoding it.

Thanks to rkreis on #sfttech IRC for the report & patch hint :)

data.title: Changes to AssetManager
data.body: Everything is described in the commit description.

data.title: Conversion: support for some uppercase file names
data.body:
The AoK:TC Collector's Edition has uppercase folder and file names for a bunch of base game files. (i.e. AoK, not AoC files.)

This attempts to fix with a different approach than #55, by just special casing for the uppercase names in addition to the normal names.

Supports `DATA/` in addition to `Data/`, and `LANGUAGE.DLL` in addition to `language.dll`.

I only this with my AoK-only disk, which also has those uppercase names, but they might not quite be the same on the Collector's Edition. So if somebody with a CE disk could confirm, would be much appreciated :)

data.title: Build instructions are incomplete for Fedora 21
data.body:
Hi,
I just tried to build the project on Fedora 21 and noticed that `fontconfig-devel` is required but not listed as prerequisite step. I suggest updating the doc. ;)
Have a great day!

data.title: Pass strings as const refs instead of uselessly copying them.
Fixing memory leaks and unsafe attribute casting
data.body: There are some memory leaks in the unit texture outlines and locations, and unsafe operations with the attributes. This fixes the leaks and puts compile time restrictions on attribute typing

data.title: Custom font rendering engine
data.body:
We could think about removing `ftgl` in favor of a customized rendering system.

For efficient rendering of the ingame console, something handcrafted renderer is needed anyway, so we can use this system for all font rendering.

Some routines for loading fonts to draw surfaces can probably still be used from `ftgl`.

data.title: Custom doxygen html output style
data.body:
The default doxygen html doc style kinda sucks, we should have some kind of customized colors, layout, etc, whatever you please.

The configuration should probably be placed in `buildsystem/templates/doxygen` and activated in `buildsystem/templates/Doxyfile.in`.

data.title: [Orphaned] perlin noise generator
data.body:
C++ rewrite in progress.
- [x] C++ rewrite of Perlin class
- [ ] documentation
- [ ] test case or demo for Perlin class
- [x] delete python implementation

Should be useful for #65.

These were generated with the python implementation, the new ones will look different.
Seed: "sftworld1", 500x500px, 10x10 grid cells, polynomial interpolation:
![perlin_sftworld1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6196356/5471009/6d0d9fe8-85f0-11e4-922e-bdba7486cce1.png)

Red: "sftworld0", green: "sftworld1", blue: "sftworld2", polynomial interpolation, dims as above:
![multicolor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6196356/5471422/ba4ec386-85f5-11e4-9408-b4e1632d1668.png)

data.title: Create/use interactive GUI elements
data.body:
It is now inconvenient to access all the of features in the game via dirty shortcuts.

Sure, the `--test` invokations are used for developers, but users should get some kind of shiny buttons
to control and select the game features.

An implementation for GUI elements is needed.
- For the engine editor, we should go for GTK/Qt stuff.
- The in-game view probably needs custom GUI elements.

Things like shift-scrolling for the building selection is inconvenient as fuck and has to be replaced.

Stellarium has a [totally awesome GUI](https://bazaar.launchpad.net/~stellarium/stellarium/trunk/files/head:/src/gui/) based on Qt, licensed GPL2+ so we should maybe take it as a start.

data.title: better pep8 compliance for py/
data.body:
`pep8 --ignore=E251,E221,E501,E241 py/`

Ignored errors are:
- 241 is more than one space after `:`
- 501 is line too long (>=80)
- 221 spaces before operator
- 251 spaces around keyword param assignment =

These errors could be fixed with a big amount of work, the `dataformat/` struct definitions get way uglier then.

Although ignoring some of the errors, this is certainly better than before.
Next up one could use `pylint` to find unused variables, imports etcetc which were not fixed by this patch.

data.title: Merge heuristic path cost functions into one
data.body: This functionality also possibly opens up easy extension of new similar costs into the same functionality without copying and pasting code.

data.title: Moving uneeded shared_ptrs to unique_ptr
data.body:
A lot of the objects that were using shared_ptrs actually had a sole owner and a well-defined lifetime, so I refactored them to be held in unique_ptrs.

This makes it easier to reason about the value's lifetime, as well as ensures that destruction is deterministic and has performance benefits.

The shared pointers being used in pathfinding are removed in #150

data.title: zsh completion module
data.body:
There should be an openage completion module allowing to select the demos, tests and (soon) benchmarks.

This file is installed to `/usr/share/zsh/site-functions` but it should also be available for developers somehow (the least elegant solution would be sourcing that file manually).

data.title: Shots fired & Delta Graphics
data.body:
Game Functions:
- Projectiles use game data for range and arc shape
- Any building can be used as a dropsite
- Units can garrision in any building
- Resource objects can be gathered from
- F5/F9 quick save and load functions

Graphics:
- UnitTexture class handles delta graphics
- Delta graphics can be animated and directional (ships)
- TerrainObjects handle building annexes using child/parent spaces
- Switch between villager graphics depending on which resource is gathered

User Interface:
- Selection of units by boxing
- Display of units hitpoints

Notes:
requires assets to be reconverted.

currently unsure how about the "projectile_arc" parameter from exported data should be used
for scorpions, projectile_arc = 0
for onagers, projectile_arc = 0.4
for regular archers, projectile_arc = -0.06

data.title: New logging system
data.body:
A new policy-based logging system.
See log_configure.h for the actual configuration and some examples.

data.title: Add frames per second limiter
data.body:
Currently, the fps are only capped by vsync.

On my machine, vsync is deactivated once the game windows is move to background (no longer visible), and the fps skyrocket and heat up my machine to 96Â°C.

There should be some capping which could be configurable through a command line option `--fps 60`. 

This is obviously enabled additionaly to vsync, so when vsync is active, the fps limit should not prevent frame skips (e.g. just use 70 as limit).

data.title: Ensure glew.h is loaded before gl.h
